virtual int getSize (  )  const [pure virtual]

Get the size of the state vector (y) and time derivative of the state vector (dydt).

The size is the number of integrated variables.

Returns:
Size of the state vector y.

Implemented in ModelIntegrand, and ModelIntegrandForActuators.

Compute the integrand.

The integrand is the time derivative of the states (dydt).

virtual void computeJacobian ( double  t,
double  y[],
double *  dydtdy 
) [inline, virtual]

Compute the Jacobian of the integrand.

The Jacobian is the partial derivative of the integrand with respect to the states. The Jacobian is denoted here by dydtdy.

It is thus an n x n square matrix:

| dydt_1/dy_1 dydt_1/dy_2 ... dydt_1/dy_n |
| dydt_2/dy_1 dydt_2/dy_2 ... dydt_2/dy_n |
| ... ... ... ... |
| dydt_n/dy_1 dydt_n/dy_2 ... dydt_n/dy_n |

The _i above indicates the ith element of a vector.

The elements of the Jacobian matrix are assumed to be held sequentially in memory as in an array. The assumed order of the elements is the first column (dydt/dy_1), followed by the second column (dydt/dy_2), ..., all the way to the last column (dydt/dy_n).

Parameters:
t Current time.
y State vector (size = getSize()).
dydtdy Jacobian- partial derivative of the integrand with respect to the states (size = getSize() x getSize()).
